result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christ Westly Covington

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christ Westly Covington in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Christ Westly Covington.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Wait was just appointed to the case and does not have discovery or an offer and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 12-9-22 at 8:30 am for a status conference by zoom.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Christ Westly Covington appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Margo Elise Clark appeared by video for Christ Westly Covington.  Prosecuting attorney Anthony J Moore appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Received and Filed. Court ordered no contact with LQS
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
